title: Math Ecology
text:
My classic academic training is in mathematical and statistical modeling of ecological systems.
My work primarily focuses on natural resource management. I use difference/differential equation modeling, agent-based modeling, matrix projection models, and more. Here are some highlights of my work:

Managing the sylvatic plague in black-tailed prairie dogs
De-extinction strategies for the passenger pigeon
Vaccination strategies for white-nose syndrome in little brown bats
Modeling sublethal stressors on bee colonies
Hunting strategies to suppress the winter tick epizootic in moose
Modeling pollen competition and interference in plants

My complete works can be found on my Google Scholar Profile
I enjoy working with interdisciplinary teams, and with colleagues across the world. If you’re interested in working together, please reach out to me!
I’ve worked with several student researchers, from REUs, programs internal to UWL, federal scholar programs, etc. If you are interested in undergraduate research, please reach out to me!

title: CV
text: You can preview and download my CV at this link.

title: Coulee Data Center
text:
I founded the Coulee Data Center (CDC) in 2025. The CDC website is under construction! The mission of the CDC is to
“…deliver actionable, data-driven insights at no cost to non-profit organizations and public services in the Coulee Region of Southwestern Wisconsin and Southeastern Minnesota, empowering them to make informed decisions and amplify their impact.”
Each semester the CDC collaborates with a local partner on a data analysis project. Our first partner is Habitat for Humanity of the Greater La Crosse Region! More details about our work is available on our CDC website (under construction).
If you know of a local partner that would like to work with the CDC, or you would like to cover the work of the CDC, please reach out to me!
Each semester the CDC appoints up to three students as “Data Diplomats” that work on these projects. If you’re interested in becoming a Data Diplomat, please reach out to me!

title: About
text:
Professional Summary

In 2018, I completed my undergraduate degree at Wichita State University in Mathematics. In 2023, I completed my Ph.D. in Mathematical Biology and my M.S. in Statistics from The University of Tennessee, Knoxville, in Christopher’s Strickland’s Lab.
Professionally, my research is split in two parts.

I am the director and founder of the Coulee Data Center, an organization providing pro bono data analysis services to community services in the greater La Crosse, WI area.
I am actively publishing research in applications of mathematical ecology.



Personal Summary

I am originally from the Lansing, MI area. I met my wife, Adrianna, during my time in Kansas. We have a daughter (Ruth), dog (Sunday), and a cat (Checkers).
In my free time, I train my dog for AKC hunt tests and rally competitions. I enjoy hiking and watching college basketball and football.

title: Contact
text: If you’re interested in working with the Coulee Data Center, my work in mathematical ecology, have an opportunity you want to share, or have another inquiry, the best way to reach me is via email: delzinga@uwlax.edu.

title: David C. Elzinga
text:
Welcome to my professional website. I’m currently an Assistant Professor of Statistics at the University of Wisconsin-La Crosse.
This website is a great place to learn more about my lab, the Coulee Data Center, and my academic work in Mathematical Ecology.
